name: Really Simple CAPTCHA for Buddypress
author: Bernie Tisbe

sections.description:
This plugin integrates Really Simple Captcha plugin to the Buddypress registration page. Thus, its function is dependent on both of them.

Why RS Captcha for Buddypress registration page?

– Number of Downloads

By the time of writing, RS Captcha has already been downloaded 2,569,017 times by users of Contact Form 7 and plugin developers.

– Less conflict with other plugins

RS Captcha is supported by Contact Form 7 and other WordPress plugins. Running two or more Captcha plugins at the same time can cause undesirable effects on your site’s performance. Why not choose the Captcha plugin with wide range of support?

– Really Simple to use

As the name of this plugin suggests, it’s really easy to use. This plugin is just a little addition to the security of the Buddypress registration page.

– Prevent piling up of pending users

Users who don’t activate their accounts, in the case of spammers, are still being recorded in the database as pending users. If you’re one the people who don’t like them piling up like that (like me!), then you’ll love this plugin.

Requirements

Apparently, the activation of RS Captcha and Buddypress plugins is required for this plugin to work.

You can also check this page out for updates.
sections.installation:
Manual installation

  1. Download this plugin in zip file.
  2. On your dashboard, upload the plugin.
  3. Activate.

Streamlined installation

  1. On your dashboard, search for ‘Really Simple Captcha for Buddypress’ on the search box.
  2. Click Install.
  3. Activate.
sections.faq:
I have installed both RS Captcha and Buddypress but it’s still not working.

Make sure you have =activated= both plugins or updated to version 1.2 or later.

I have a problem with the plugin.

Please post your queries on the Support page.

I can’t make Buddypress or Really Simple Captcha to work.

Please post your queries on their support page.
sections.changelog:
1.2

  • Changed warning message.

1.1

  • Changed the ‘confusing’ warning message. (minimal change)

1.0

  • First version of the plugin.

upgrade_notice.1.2: Changed code on detecting activation of the two plugins. Thanks to [Waseem](https://gist.github.com/wsenjer/d6969cc1accd21f38427/ "github gist").
upgrade_notice.1.1: No need to upgrade if you don't find the warning message confusing.
upgrade_notice.1.0: No need to upgrade yet. Just download.
